title: European Senior Ladies' Championship
text:
The European Senior Ladies' Championship is an annual European <a href="amateur">amateur</a> <a href="golf">golf</a> championship for women over 50 (previously 55) organized by the <a href="European%20Golf%20Association">European Golf Association</a>. 
The inaugural event was held in 1996, with 25 editions have been contested so far. It is now played in conjunction with the <a href="European%20Senior%20Men%27s%20Championship">European Senior Men's Championship</a>.
Format.
The championship is opened to women aged above 50 years old.
The format of this competition consists of three rounds of stroke play, with a cut after the second round out of which the lowest 33 ladies' scores can qualify for the final round.
Past results.
Source:
Nations Cup.
From 2000 to 2006, a Nations Cup was contested. This was discontinued when a separate <a href="European%20Senior%20Ladies%27%20Team%20Championship">European Senior Ladies' Team Championship</a> was introduced.
